intro: Chalepophyllum guyanense var. cuneatum, commonly known as the Guyana cuneatum, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
